course_title: U.S. Culture and Language for Law
course_description: This seminar is designed to prepare students for the teaching and learning in US law classes and to give them an opportunity to review the principles of written US academic legal discourse. It introduces students to how professors expect them to learn in US law classes and the principles of US written discourse. Students will practice the skills they learn through a Writing Project in which they critique their own writing based on the principles discussed in class.
sections: Class Nbr: 2817, Section #: 001, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: Th 1-2p, Instructor: K. Schaetzel, Status: Open
